en: Today is turning into one of the longest days of your life.
zh: 今天將會是你一生中最漫長的一天。

en: This latest development is for you, Future Jerry, because you may not be dying today.
zh: 這就是你眼下的狀態，未來的傑瑞，因為你今天可能還不會死掉。

en: It’s hard to make sense of. It only unfolded an hour ago.
zh: 很難弄明白一個小時前發生了什麼。

en: Henry should be the one to tell it, but Henry’s job is to create. Your job, Jerry, is to tell it like it is.
zh: 亨利本來可以告訴我的，但是亨利的工作是創作，這是你的工作，傑瑞。

en: You completed the second suicide note. This one to Eva. The notes were neatly folded into separate envelopes, each one labeled and left on the desk where they couldn’t be missed.
zh: 你寫完第二份遺書，這份是給伊娃的，你把遺書整齊地疊好放在兩個不同的信封里，每一封都做了標記，並且放在辦公桌的顯眼處。

en: The trash bags were all taped in place, and you were moments away from Captain A finally having to abandon ship.
zh: 你把垃圾袋都整齊地粘好，你要離開「阿爾茨船長」一會兒，因為他最後棄船了。

en: You were sitting in the office chair looking at the couch wondering if the couch wouldn’t be better for what you had in mind, but it would mean shifting the trash bags and that really was just more stalling. Plus it would ruin the couch.
zh: 你坐在辦公椅上看著沙發，心想坐在沙發上琢磨心事再合適不過了，但這意味著就要挪動垃圾袋，何況這樣做只是拖延時間罷了，說不定還會毀了沙發。

en: No, the office chair would suffice, and really, what did it matter?
zh: 有辦公椅就足夠了，真的，弄髒辦公椅有什麼關係？

en: You weren’t going to use the pillowcase anymore.
zh: 你不打算使用枕套了。

en: The idea of being found that way, of the photograph being leaked somehow, that in a few days it would be all over the Internet—Jerry Grey wearing a pillowcase on his head, look what a fool he has become—that was an idea you couldn’t stomach.
zh: 心裏想著要是被人發現，他的死狀照片在互聯網上傳播，被炒得沸沸揚揚——傑瑞·格雷頭上套著枕套，看起來是個傻瓜，這絕對是你難以忍受的。

en: You put the barrel of the gun into your mouth and your teeth scraped against it and you didn’t like that feeling either, so you decided to fire through the side of your head instead, and you were going to do it, then you weren’t, and then you were.
zh: 你把槍管放到嘴裏，碰到了牙齒，你不喜歡這種感覺。於是你決定對準太陽穴開槍，你打算這樣做。之後你又不想這樣做了，接著你又想這樣做。

en: It was like a switch being flicked on and off. Do it, don’t do it, do it.
zh: 就像一個開關一樣，打開、關掉，這樣做、不這樣做、這樣做。

en: You thought about how some suicides fail, how the bullet changes path and rattles around the skull and makes a lot of damage but doesn’t kill. You put the gun back into your mouth.
zh: 你想過一些自殺失敗的案例，比如子彈改變彈道，擦過顱骨，雖然受傷但沒法置你于死地。

en: You were looking at the Halloween photograph on your desk of Eva dressed up as a patrol officer from CHiPs when you pulled the trigger, but it was the bloody shirt, the knife, and the dead girl you were thinking about.
zh: 你正要扣動扳機，突然看到辦公桌上的萬聖節照片，照片中的伊娃打扮成巡警，但腦中浮現的，卻是血淋淋的襯衫和刀，還有那死去的女孩。

en: The safety was on.
zh: 原來保險栓是關著的。

en: You dropped the gun on the desk and stood so quickly the chair rolled back, got caught in a crease in the tarpaulin, tipped over, and snagged the trash bag hanging on the wall behind it and ripped it down.
zh: 你把槍扔在辦公桌上，猛地站起來，椅子向後翻滾，卡在防水帆布的摺痕中，刮住掛在後面牆上的垃圾袋，把它扯了下來。

en: Thank God, she said, and her clothes were pasted to her body, sweat was dripping down her face and her cheeks were flushed.
zh: 「感謝老天。」她上氣不接下氣地說。她臉頰通紅，大汗淋漓，衣服都貼在了身上。

en: I just need another minute, you told her.
zh: 「我只需要一分鐘。」你告訴她。

en: She marched towards you. She looked at the gun, then she took in the plastic bags and the tarpaulin and the horror of it all struck her and actually brought her to a stop. Her expression changed from one of relief to one of horror.
zh: 她大步向你走來，看了看槍，撿起塑料袋和防水帆布，恐懼攫住了她，讓她停下手，表情從釋然變成恐懼。

en: She was no longer flushed. She was now ghostly pale.
zh: 她臉上的紅暈消退了，現在如幽靈般蒼白。

en: But she was still sweating, even more so, and panting.
zh: 她氣喘吁吁，仍在出汗，汗冒得越來越多。

en: I just need another minute, you said, because in that moment it felt like she was upset you hadn’t yet followed through with the plan.
zh: 「我只需要一分鐘。」你說。就在那一刻，感覺就像是你沒有按計劃行事叫她失望似的。

en: She shook her head.
zh: 她搖搖頭。

en: Please, sit down with me, she said, and when you didn’t move, she held her hand out towards you.
zh: 「來，坐到我身邊。」她說。你沒有動，她把手伸向了你：「求求你了，傑瑞。」

en: Please, Jerry. You moved to the couch and sat, but didn’t take her hand.
zh: 你走向沙發，坐了下來，但沒有握她的手。

en: I had a phone call, she said.
zh: 「我打了一個電話。」

en: I’ve been trying to ring you. It’s why I ran back. To stop you.
zh: 她說，「我一直想打電話給你，這就是我為什麼跑回來，我要阻止你。

en: I’m . . . I’m so sorry I . . . I shouldn’t have left you like that to do . . .
zh: 我……我很抱歉，我……我不應該離開你，讓你做……做你要做的事情。」

en: You wanted to put your hand on her shoulder, wanted to tell her everything was going to be okay, but you couldn’t bring yourself to do it.
zh: 你想把手撫在她的肩膀上，想告訴她沒事，但無能為力。

en: Things weren’t going to be okay, and let’s not forget, Future Jerry, that by this point in the game she was already screwing the baker and the alarm guys and who knows who else.
zh: 不會好起來的，我們千萬不要忘了，未來的傑瑞，在這場遊戲中，她一直和麵包師胡搞，和安裝警報器的人胡搞，誰知道還有誰呢？

en: Right there in that moment when you thought that, you need to know you also thought about the gun. For a second—not even that, but just a microsecond—two things happened.
zh: 就在那一刻，你忽然念及此事，只那麼一會兒工夫，就在倏忽之間，你看到了兩件事。

en: The first is you saw her pinned beneath the baker as he moved inside her, he was wearing his big baker’s white hat and it was ringed with sweat, his big baker’s white ass in the air.
zh: 第一件，你看到她被壓在麵包師身下，他伏在她身上晃動，戴著他那高高的白色麵包師的帽子，浸滿汗水，扭向一邊，屁股向上撅著。

en: The second thing you saw was the gun, you on one end of it, the other spitting out bullets into Sandra’s chest.
zh: 第二件，是那把槍，你握著槍柄，另外一人扣動扳機，子彈射入桑德拉的胸口。

en: Do you remember Mae?
zh: 「你還記得梅嗎？」

en: From one of the books?
zh: 「書里的？」

en: No.
zh: 「不是。

en: A few weeks ago you wandered off and got lost and confused and you knocked on her door.
zh: 幾個星期前，你出去遊盪，結果走丟了，神志不清。你敲她的門，你小時候曾在那座房子里住過一陣子。

en: You couldn’t remember the trip to the house, but you could remember being there, the tea and the chatting and then Sandra coming and picking you up.
zh: 你不記得是怎樣到她家的，但你能記得去過那裡，記得在那裡喝茶聊天，後來，桑德拉去接你。

en: It was the day you were trying to dump the can of spray-paint.
zh: 就是在那一天，你打算丟掉噴漆罐。

en: That’s her, Sandra said, and she sounded pleased you remembered.
zh: 「就是她。」桑德拉說。因為你還記得，她顯得很高興。

en: Hell, even you were pleased.
zh: 媽的，連你也很高興。

en: You allowed yourself a moment, a fantasy really, to imagine that the worst of the Alzheimer’s was behind you. Ahead were the five stages of getting better. She called to see how you were doing. Why?
zh: 有片刻時間，你恍然如夢，你想象著阿爾茨海默病已經被你拋諸腦後，前面等待著你的是康復的五個階段。

en: I . . . wait. What?
zh: 「我——等等，什麼？」

en: I want to see the shirt. Why?
zh: 「我想看看那件襯衫。」

en: You pried up the floorboard and showed her the shirt.
zh: 你撬開地板，把襯衫拿給她看。

en: She didn’t look as unhappy as you’d have thought.
zh: 她並沒有像你心裏想的那樣怒氣沖沖。

en: You balled the shirt up and put it back, and then she explained everything.
zh: 你把襯衫揉成團，又放了回去，她向你解釋了所有的事情。

en: You can’t remember her words exactly.
zh: 你記不清她都說了些什麼。

en: If Prick had been here with his video camera it would now all be up online to refresh your memory, but you can remember the gist of it.
zh: 要是普瑞克拿著攝像機在這裏，說不清還能恢復記憶，不過你只能記住她說的要點。

en: At around three in the morning, Mae was woken up by a knock on the door.
zh: 大約凌晨三點鐘，梅被一陣敲門聲驚醒了。

en: She opened it to find you standing there, and out on the street was a taxi you had arrived in.
zh: 她開門一看，發現是你站在那裡，街上停著你來時乘坐的計程車，你沒有帶錢。

en: You had no money, and like the last time you had gone to her house, you were confused.
zh: 像上次去她家一樣，你神志不清，茫然不解。

en: She paid the taxi driver then took you inside.
zh: 她給了計程車司機車費，然後帶你進去。

en: She told Sandra she thought about putting you back into the taxi and telling the driver to take you where he had found you, but the problem was she couldn’t know for sure where he had found you, or even that you wouldn’t just jump out at a red light and run for the hills.
zh: 她告訴桑德拉說，她想過打發你坐進計程車，然後告訴司機把你送到發現你的地方，但問題是她不敢確定他是在哪兒發現你的，她甚至不敢確定你會不會在紅燈前跳出計程車，跑到山裡去。

en: You sat at her kitchen table and drank a cup of tea and when she went to call Sandra, you asked her not to. This, of course, was after she explained you didn’t live there anymore, which by then you were figuring out.
zh: 你坐在她家的餐桌旁，喝了一杯茶，她要去打電話給桑德拉了，你叫她不要打，她向你解釋你並不住在這裏。

en: Your reason for not wanting her to call Sandra was simple—and you were able to show Mae just how simple it was by showing her the video of you ruining the wedding and what was left of your life.
zh: 這時，你終於弄明白了。你不想讓她給桑德拉打電話的理由很簡單，你想讓梅看你毀掉婚禮的視頻，你讓她知道你的生命中沒有什麼值得留戀的了。

en: She agreed then not to call Sandra, but insisted that she call somebody.
zh: 後來，她同意不給桑德拉打電話了，但堅持要給別人打電話。

en: You told her about Hans. You had your phone. You made the call, and he didn’t answer, which was no surprise since it was in the middle of the night, so you left a message.
zh: 你告訴她漢斯是你的朋友，你帶著手機，你給他打了電話，他沒有接，這並不奇怪。

en: You were with Mae for several hours, Sandra told you.
zh: 「你跟梅在一塊兒待了好幾個小時。」

en: The news says Belinda was killed around three a.m.
zh: 桑德拉告訴你，「新聞里稱貝琳達是凌晨三點左右遇害的。

en: That’s the same time you were knocking on Mae’s door.
zh: 當時，你正在敲梅家的大門。

en: The police keep saying they want to talk to anybody who saw anything that night, and want to talk to anybody who lived on her street who was awake around that time.
zh: 警察一直在說，他們希望跟那天晚上任何看到可疑跡象的人談談，想跟和她住在同一街道上、當時還沒有入睡的任何人談談。

en: Three a.m., Jerry, don’t you see what that means?
zh: 凌晨三點，傑瑞，難道你不明白這是什麼意思嗎？

en: If you had killed her before then, Mae would have seen the blood on your shirt.
zh: 如果你在那之前就殺害了她，那麼梅將會看到你襯衫上的血跡。

en: I asked her what you were wearing, and she said the same clothes from the wedding, from the online video.
zh: 我問她，你當時穿著什麼，她說是參加婚禮的那套衣服，錄在線視頻時穿的那套衣服。

en: Then Hans picked you up.
zh: 後來，漢斯就去接你了。」

en: You’ve spoken to Hans?
zh: 「你跟漢斯講了？」

en: you asked.
zh: 你問。

en: Not yet, she said. Something must have happened after he dropped you off, but whatever that was, it doesn’t involve Belinda.
zh: 「還沒有，」她說，「他把你送回家后，一定發生了什麼事情，但不管怎麼樣，都不關貝琳達的事。

en: She was already dead by then.
zh: 因為當時她已經死了。」

en: Then whose blood is it?
zh: 「那會是誰的血呢？」

en: Sandra went quiet then, because she didn’t have an answer.
zh: 桑德拉沒有說話，因為她也沒有答案。

en: You were picturing the whole cycle again, watching the news, waiting for the phone call, waiting to see who else was dead.
zh: 你再次回顧了事情的整個過程，看新聞，等電話，等著看還有誰死了。

en: But then Sandra did have an answer.
zh: 但是，隨後桑德拉有了答案，你豁然開朗了。

en: And it made perfect sense. You haven’t spoken to Hans, she said.
zh: 「你還沒有對漢斯說。」

en: Is it possible it’s his blood?
zh: 「有沒有可能是他的血？」

en: You thought about it, as if it were a memory you could recall, but of course it wasn’t.
zh: 你思考著整個問題，好像你能回憶起來，但是，不行。

en: Maybe you’d had an altercation, and he had driven away bleeding and . . . was he even still alive?
zh: 也許你們發生了爭執，他開車離開了，身上流著血……或者，他還活著嗎？

en: Jerry?
zh: 「傑瑞？」

en: I don’t know.
zh: 「我不知道。

en: I guess it’s possible.
zh: 我想有可能。」

en: She looked at the trash bags, the tarpaulin, and she started to cry.
zh: 桑德拉看著垃圾袋、防水帆布，哭了起來。

en: I almost didn’t make it back in time.
zh: 「我差一點兒沒能及時趕回來。

en: I rang and rang, but you didn’t answer, and Mae only rang me because she wanted to check in, she said she regretted not ringing me the other night, and if she hadn’t . . . or if she had put it off a little longer, then right now you’d . . . you’d— You finally reached out to her, placing one hand on her knee and the other on her arm.
zh: 我給你打電話，一遍又一遍地打，但是你沒有接，梅打電話給我，因為她想了解下情況，她說她後悔那天晚上沒有給我打電話，如果她沒有……或者，如果她拖延久一點兒，那麼，現在你……你就……」你把一隻手搭在她的膝蓋上，另一隻扶她的胳膊。

en: But she did ring you, and you did make it home in time, you said, and you felt relief, but you also felt scared because there was still the matter of the bloody knife and the shirt.
zh: 「但她確實打電話給你了，而你還沒有回家。」你說。你感到如釋重負，但是，你也感到害怕。血淋淋的刀和襯衫仍在這裏，這表明的確有事情發生過。

en: Let’s clean this up, then call Hans, she said.
zh: 「我們先打掃一下，然後給漢斯打電話。」她說。

en: Cleaning up the room was everything in reverse, and it felt weird because hanging up the trash bags and laying out the tarpaulin, well, never during any of that did you think you’d be putting this stuff away.
zh: 清理房間就是把所有的東西歸位，掛起的垃圾袋，鋪好的防水帆布，這些都很詭異。不過你做這些事情時，還想過要親手把這些東西處理掉。

en: Sandra wasn’t able to get hold of Hans, but left a message.
zh: 桑德拉沒有找到漢斯，不過，她給他留了言。

en: She sounded concerned, yet you know she’d have forgiven you if you had hurt him.
zh: 她的聲音聽起來很關切。你知道就算你傷害了她，她還是會原諒你的。

en: It’s worse than that, you told him, and then you poured yourself a drink.
zh: 「比那更糟。」你告訴他。你給自己倒了杯酒。

en: You asked him if it were true that he had picked you up. He said yes.
zh: 你問他，他是不是真的去接你了，他說是的。

en: You asked if the two of you had fought, if you had cut him, and he said no.
zh: 你又問你們兩個是不是打架了，你是不是傷到他了，他說沒有。

en: You asked if there was blood on your shirt, and he said nothing then, as if he was the one who was having problems remembering.
zh: 你問他當時你襯衫上是不是有血，他沒有說話，就好像他出現了記憶障礙。

en: So you asked him again, and then he said yes, there was blood.
zh: 於是你又問了一遍，然後他說是的，到處都是血。

en: He said he had asked you about it at the time, but you had no answer.
zh: 他說他當時就問過你，你沒有回答。

en: You asked where the knife came from, but he hadn’t seen one.
zh: 你問他刀是從哪裡來的，他說他沒有見過。

en: It doesn’t line up with what Nurse Mae told Sandra, but somewhere between all that hearsay, and the gin and tonics, the details have gotten lost.
zh: 這和梅護士告訴桑德拉的相去甚遠。所有的傳聞，加奎寧水的杜松子酒，所有的細節，此刻都模糊不清。但是，所有的一切都會水落石出的。

en: Hans is on his way over.
zh: 漢斯已經在路上了。

en: Henry is trying to say something, but he can’t find the words, which is a shame because it feels important.
zh: 亨利想說些什麼，但他找不到合適的字眼，於他而言這是一種恥辱。

en: Hopefully Hans and Henry can work together to help figure it out.
zh: 希望漢斯和亨利可以聯手把這一切弄清楚。

en: You asked Hans to bring over another couple of bottles of gin too.
zh: 你讓漢斯再拿來兩瓶杜松子酒。

en: Hans will know what to do. Solving problems—that’s such a Hans thing.
zh: 漢斯知道該怎麼做的，漢斯一貫擅長解決問題。

en: Jerry is sitting in a taxi handing money over to the driver when his phone rings.
zh: 傑瑞坐在計程車里，他把錢遞給司機時，電話響了。

en: “You okay, buddy?”
zh: 「你沒事吧，夥計？」

en: The driver looks concerned. He’s a big guy whose chest is hanging on his stomach, and whose arms are as thick as Jerry’s legs.
zh: 司機憂心忡忡的，他是個大塊頭，胸部都垂到肚子上，手臂和傑瑞的腿一樣粗。

en: To Jerry he looks like a human baked potato.
zh: 在傑瑞眼裡，他像個烤土豆。

en: “I’m . . . I’m okay.”
zh: 「我……我沒事。」

en: “You sure you’re okay?”
zh: 「你確定你沒事？」

en: Jerry looks out the window. He’s outside his house.
zh: 傑瑞看著窗外，他就在他家外面。

en: The phone is still ringing.
zh: 手機仍在響著。

en: “This is where I live,” he says.
zh: 「我就住在這裏。」他說。

en: “Then good job I brought you here,” the taxi driver says.
zh: 「還好我把你帶到這裏。」計程車司機說，「你確定你沒事嗎？」

en: “Yeah, yeah, I’m okay.”
zh: 「是啊，是的，我沒事。」

en: The driver hands him his change.
zh: 司機把找零遞給他。

en: Jerry looks at his wrist, but he’s not wearing a watch.
zh: 傑瑞看看自己的手腕，他沒有戴手錶。

en: “What’s the time?”
zh: 「幾點了？」

en: “Just after six.”
zh: 「剛過六點。」

en: He climbs out of the car. The day is darkening.
zh: 他邁出汽車，外面夜色如水。

en: It’s cool too. He looks down at the phone, but doesn’t recognize it. Where has he been?
zh: 他低頭看著手機，但他認不出是誰的。

en: Shopping? Visiting friends?
zh: 購物還是訪友？

en: Jerry answers the phone. “Hello?”
zh: 傑瑞接聽電話：「

en: “I’m on my way.”
zh: 「我在路上。」

en: “Hans?”
zh: 「漢斯？」

en: “I’ve got him,” Hans says.
zh: 「我找到他了。」漢斯說，「連我自己都不敢相信，但我找到了他。」

en: “Got who?”
A pause from Hans, and then, “Are you . . are you okay?”
zh: 漢斯停頓了一下，然後接著說：「你……你還好嗎？」

en: Jerry looks at his house.
zh: 傑瑞看著他的房子。

en: Yes, he’s okay.
zh: 是的，他還好。

en: He must have wandered, but where he went he doesn’t know.
zh: 他剛才一定是出去遊盪了，但是他去了哪裡，他不知道。

en: What he does know is that lately he hasn’t been well. He’s been forgetting things.
zh: 他只知道最近他狀態不好，他總是健忘得很。

en: He pats down his pockets, but can’t find his keys.
zh: 他拍拍口袋，沒摸到鑰匙。

en: Sometimes he climbs out windows and goes where he shouldn’t, and if that’s what he’s just done, then perhaps he can climb back in.
zh: 有時候，他會從窗戶爬出去，去到他不應該去的地方，如果他剛剛這樣做了，那麼他也可以從窗戶爬回去。

en: “I’m fine,” he tells Hans.
zh: 「我很好。」他告訴漢斯。

en: “You’re still at the park, right?”
zh: 「你還在公園裡，對吧？」

en: “What park?”
zh: 「什麼公園？」

en: “The park where I told you to wait for me.”
zh: 「我讓你在公園裡等我。」

en: “I don’t remember any park.
zh: 「我不記得什麼公園。

en: I’m back home.”
zh: 我回家了。」

en: “The nursing home?”
zh: 「療養院？」

en: “What nursing home?”
zh: 「什麼療養院？」

en: Jerry asks, though something about that feels familiar, but he can’t figure out why.
zh: 傑瑞問，雖然那個地方很親切，但他弄不清楚為什麼。

en: He reaches his office. The window is shut and locked.
zh: 他走到寫作房窗邊，窗口禁閉而且鎖住了。

en: He can see through the window and though everything looks the way it always looks, there is something a little different.
zh: 他可以通過窗口看到裏面的東西，雖然一切看起來都按原樣放著，但還是略有不同。

en: The computer looks newer than he remembers, and things are in slightly different places, but for the most part it’s how it should be . . . except off a little.
zh: 電腦看起來比他記憶中的新了些，有些東西擺放的位置也變了，但大多數東西依然各就其位，除了有一點點偏離。

en: “No, I’m back at my house.
zh: 「不，我回到我家了。

en: What park are you talking about?”
zh: 你在說什麼公園？」

en: “You’re back home?
zh: 「你回家了？

en: At your house?”
zh: 在你家？」

en: “Pretty much.”
zh: 「差不多。」

en: “What does that mean?”
zh: 「這是什麼意思？」

en: He makes his way to the front door.
zh: 他走向前門。

en: Maybe Sandra will be home from work. She’s going to give him a hard time, but if he’s lucky by the end of the day he will have forgotten.
zh: 也許桑德拉馬上要下班回家了，她會讓他難堪的，不過要是幸運的話他會忘記的。

en: And if she isn’t home, there’s a spare key hidden in the backyard.
zh: 如果她不在家，後院還藏著把備用鑰匙。

en: Funny how he can remember where the key is, the day they wrapped it in a small plastic bag and hid it in the garden just under the edge of the deck, but he can’t remember the last thirty minutes.
zh: 有趣，他居然能記得鑰匙在那裡。一天，他把它包在一個小塑料袋裡藏在花園裡，就在露台邊緣下面，但他居然不記得三十分鐘前的事了。

en: Perhaps funny is the wrong word.
zh: 也許用「有趣」這個字眼並不對。

en: “Jerry?”
zh: 「傑瑞？」

en: “It means I’m right outside, about to head inside.”
zh: 「我的意思是我現在在外面，準備進去了。」

en: “You’ve remembered where the journal is?”
zh: 「你想起日記在哪裡了？」

en: “You know about that?”
zh: 「你知道？」

en: “Listen, Jerry, you need to listen to me very carefully.
zh: 「聽著，傑瑞，你需要仔細地聽我講。

en: I want you to stay on the sidewalk. I’m going to come and pick you up.”
zh: 我想讓你待在人行道上，我這就來接你。」

en: He’s almost at the front door.
zh: 他已經在門口了。

en: He searches his pockets again in case the keys are hidden in there somewhere—how many times has he looked for his wallet or keys or phone in a pocket only to have found them there on the second or third time hunting through?
zh: 他再次摸索口袋，以防鑰匙藏在口袋裡的什麼地方。他已經有很多次在口袋裡翻找錢包、鑰匙或手機，結果一無所獲，卻在第二次第三次翻找時，發現它們就在那裡。

en: He also doesn’t find the keys. He does find a pair of Sandra’s earrings, which seems a little odd.
zh: 他沒有找到鑰匙，只找到桑德拉的一對耳環，這有點兒奇怪。

en: “Jerry?”
zh: 「傑瑞？」

en: “Yeah, yeah, I heard you, but you’re not making any sense.”
zh: 「是啊，是的，我聽見你說話了，但是，你究竟想說什麼？」

en: “Concentrate, Jerry.
zh: 「集中精力，傑瑞。

en: What do you remember about today?”
zh: 有關今天你還記得什麼？」

en: He thinks back over the day.
zh: 他開始回想這一天發生的事。

en: He actually can’t remember anything. That happens sometimes.
zh: 其實他什麼也不記得了，有時會發生這種情況。

en: His family is worried he’s going to mess up the wedding because of it. He knows they’re thinking of putting him into care.
zh: 正因為如此，他的家人才擔心他會把婚禮搞砸，他知道他們想控制他。

en: “Jerry?”
zh: 「傑瑞？」

en: “I don’t remember much,” he admits.
zh: 「我不記得了。」他承認。

en: “You don’t live in that house anymore, Jerry.”
zh: 「你已經不再住那座房子里了，傑瑞。」

en: “Yeah, right,” he says, and then laughs, and then he starts knocking.
zh: 「是的，對。」他說著，笑了起來。

en: “Are you knocking?” Hans asks.
zh: 「你在敲門？」漢斯問。

en: “I don’t have my key.”
zh: 「我沒帶鑰匙。」

en: “Seriously, Jerry, you don’t live there anymore.
zh: 「我說真的，傑瑞，你已經不在那裡住了。

en: You need to wait for me on the street.”
zh: 你得在街上等我。」

en: “But—”
“Are the police around?
zh: 「警察在嗎？

en: Do you see them?”
zh: 你看到他們了嗎？」

en: “What?
zh: 「什麼？

en: Why would there be police here?”
zh: 為什麼這裡會有警察？」

en: “You live in a nursing home.
zh: 「你現在住在療養院。

en: You’ve wandered off.
zh: 你出去遊盪了。

en: You rang me earlier and I came and picked you up from a shopping mall.
zh: 你之前打電話給我，我來了，在一家商場接你。

en: You don’t remember any of this?”
zh: 你不記得了嗎？」

en: “None of it,” Jerry says, annoyed at Hans for still pushing this silly joke.
zh: 「不記得了。」傑瑞說，漢斯還在說一些愚蠢的笑話，他很惱火。

en: “You have to—”
“I don’t get it,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我不懂。」傑瑞說，「我不想聽笑話了。」

en: “I’m not joking.”
zh: 「我沒有開玩笑。」

en: “I can see all my stuff through the office window.”
zh: 「我可以透過寫作房的窗戶看到我所有的東西。」

en: “That’s not your stuff.”
zh: 「那不是你的東西。」

en: He knocks again, but there’s no answer.
zh: 他再次敲門，但無人應答。

en: Either Sandra isn’t home or she’s in the shower.
zh: 桑德拉要麼不在家，要麼就是在洗澡。

en: The phone starts ringing again, but he ignores it.
zh: 電話又響起來了，但他沒再理會。

en: He makes his way to the side gate, noticing that the shrubs they planted last spring have all been torn up and replaced by different ones, a layer of bark put down, a family of garden gnomes guardians to it all. He reaches through and unlatches the side gate, and when it swings open he’s staring at a yard that feels slightly out of whack.
zh: 他走到側門，注意到他們去年春天種的灌木都被扯掉了，被另一種灌木所替代，堆著一層一層樹皮，擺放著一些花園精靈守護神。

en: When the hell did that happen?
zh: 究竟發生了什麼？

en: He’s used to losing things by the pool, but never has he actually lost the pool.
zh: 他以前常在游泳池邊丟東西，但從來沒有想過會真的丟掉整座游泳池。

en: The garden is different too, but the deck is the same, as are the pavers surrounding it, and he digs his fingers under one and lifts it.
zh: 花園也和以往不同了，但露台還沒有變化，四周鋪設著路磚，他把手指伸到一塊磚頭下，撬開它。

en: The key is still there.
zh: 鑰匙還在。

en: He steps up on the deck and opens the bag and at the same time looks through the windows of the French doors into the house. The world tilts further.
zh: 他走上露台，打開包，同時透過法式門的玻璃向裏面張望，裏面的天地更是出乎他的意料了。

en: He doesn’t recognize any of the furniture, and there’s a large painting on the lounge wall of horses running along a beach that he doesn’t remember ever seeing.
zh: 所有傢具他都不認識了，客廳牆上掛著一幅巨大的油畫，畫著海灘美景，駿馬奔騰，他也不曾見過。

en: Sandra has finally done it, she’s kicked him out and the baker has moved in, all the furniture has been replaced, and she didn’t even have the decency to let him know.
zh: 桑德拉終於做到了，她把他踢出去，讓麵包師搬了進來，換掉了所有的傢具，她甚至都沒有告訴他！

en: He gets the key out of the bag.
zh: 他把鑰匙從包里拿出來。

en: “What are you doing here?”
zh: 「你在這裏做什麼？」

en: He turns towards the voice.
zh: 他轉向聲音的來源。

en: Mrs. Smith has always reminded him of a generic grandmother he’d throw into one of the books for some bad guy to toss down a flight of stairs.
zh: 史密斯太太總是讓他想起祖母，他會為了保護她把書當武器砸向惡徒，把他扔下樓梯。

en: “Look, I appreciate your concern,” he says, “but I’m fine.
zh: 「謝謝你關心我。」他說，「但是，我很好。

en: And as you can see we’ve taken care of the gardens.
zh: 你也看到了，我們打理了花園。

en: Thanks for stopping by.”
zh: 謝謝你來看我。」

en: That’s when he notices there’s one thing about her that he’s overlooked. She’s holding a hockey stick. She has both hands tightly wrapped around the handle, with the heel pointing in his direction.
zh: 他注意到他忽略了一件事情：她手裡拿著一根曲棍球棒，兩隻手緊緊握著手柄，腳衝著他這邊。

en: Is this a mugging?
zh: 她是搶劫嗎？

en: “I’ve called the police,” she says, so this isn’t a mugging, and the words trigger a memory, the same woman saying the same thing, and he was sitting in a car when she said it, he was in the passenger seat and they were parked right there on the road, and who was he sitting next to?
zh: 「我打電話報了警。」她說。所以這不是搶劫了，但這話勾起了他的一段回憶，一個女人說過同樣的話，她說話時他正坐在一輛車裡的乘客座位上，他們停在路上，坐在他旁邊的那個人是誰？

en: “They’re going to lock you away for what you’ve done, for ripping out my roses and setting fire to my car.”
zh: 「他們會把你關起來，因為你所做過的一切，因為你毀掉了我的玫瑰，因為你放火燒毀我的車。」

en: She adjusts her grip on the hockey stick. “And for spraying that word on my house.”
zh: 她調整曲棍球棒的握姿，「因為你在我家噴了那些字。」

en: “What are you talking . . .” he says, then the images all come rushing, so many of them at one time it makes him dizzy, so many he can’t make any sense of them.
zh: 「你在說什麼……」他說，接著一幅幅畫面奔騰著浮現在眼前，讓他有些暈眩，但他對這些畫面沒有絲毫印象。

en: He sits down on the doorstep with Mrs. Smith watching him, looking as though she wants to wind up her arms and let loose with that hockey stick.
zh: 他在門口坐下，史密斯太太看著他，她看起來好像要揮舞雙臂，把那個曲棍球棒砸過來。

en: “Nobody is buying the Alzheimer’s bullshit, Mr. Grey, so stop playing that card.
zh: 「沒有人會買狗屁阿爾茨海默病的賬，格雷先生，所以不要再玩弄這種把戲了。

en: You’re a no-good, rotten son of a bitch who murders women for fun, and if you—”
zh: 你是個無賴，是個道德敗壞的渾蛋，你竟然為了取樂謀殺好幾個女人，如果你——」

en: “What?”
zh: 「你說什麼？」

en: “If you think that you can sneak back into your old house and—”
zh: 「如果你認為你可以偷偷回到你的老房子，並且——」

en: “What?”
zh: 「什麼？」

en: “And kill the new owners, well, you take one more step and I’ll put this through the side of your head.”
zh: 「殺死新主人，好吧，你要是再往前走一步，我就用這個抽你腦袋。」

en: She changes the angle of the hockey stick to make it look more threatening to prove her point.
zh: 她改變曲棍球棒的角度，讓它看起來更具有威脅性，以證明她不是在說笑而已。

en: “I made the national side back in my day, so don’t think I don’t know how to use it.”
zh: 「我剛從國家隊效力回來，所以不要以為我不知道怎麼用。」

en: The national side?
zh: 國家隊？

en: At what?
zh: 什麼？

en: Hockey-stick fencing?
zh: 曲棍球？擊劍？

en: “What are you talking about?”
zh: 「你到底在說什麼？」

en: “You’re rotten inside, Mr. Grey. Mean to the core.”
zh: 「你爛透了，格雷先生，我是說你心腸爛透了。」

en: “What kind of person makes up this shit?”
zh: 他對她說，「是什麼人才會這麼扯淡？」

en: Then he realizes he’s the kind of person who makes up this shit.
zh: 隨後他意識到他就是這種會扯淡的人。

en: He does it for a living. He’s a professional liar.
zh: 為了生計，他成了一個專業扯淡的文字騙子。

en: “Your wife is dead because of you.” “What?” “You killed her.”
zh: 她說，並沖他揮揮曲棍球棒，「你妻子因為你死了。」

en: well now, she shouldn’t have said it. Shouldn’t. Have.
zh: 聽她這麼說……她不應該這樣說的。

en: He’s heavier and stronger and younger and madder and he pushes her easily back down the pathway.
zh: 他更重、更強壯、更年輕、更瘋狂一些，他輕而易舉地把她推回到小路上。

en: Her foot goes into the garden off to the side, she stumbles, holding onto the hockey stick to try and keep her balance, and suddenly he realizes what’s about to happen.
zh: 她的腳陷入花園草地，打了個趔趄，差點兒絆倒了。她抱著曲棍球棒想保持平衡，突然他意識到即將發生什麼，雖然她很煩人，但他不希望看到她摔在地上，弄破腦袋。

en: As annoying as she is, the last thing he wants is her falling over and cracking her head open. He tries to keep his grip on the hockey stick to stop her from falling, but she’s too heavy, and the stick comes out of his hands.
zh: 他想抓住曲棍球棒不讓她摔倒，但她太重了，球棒從他的手裡脫開。

en: She loses her balance then and topples over, her ass hitting the ground a second before her back, her head hitting a second later, and as he stands there staring at her, he realizes what she said is true—Sandra is dead.
zh: 她失去了平衡，然後重重地摔在地上。她的屁股先撞在地上，接著是後背，最後是她的頭。他站在那兒盯著她，他意識到她說的是真的——桑德拉已經死了。

en: But it’s Hans that is coming for him, not the police, Hans coming around the side of the house, Hans coming to a stop where Mrs. Smith is making friends with the lawn. She isn’t moving.
zh: 不過，來的不是警察，而是漢斯，他從房子的另一邊繞了過來，在史密斯太太摔倒的那塊草坪上止住腳步。

en: “What the hell, Jerry?”
zh: 「搞什麼鬼，傑瑞？」

en: “It . . . it was an accident.”
zh: 「這……這是意外。」

en: “Is she . . . ?”
“I don’t know, I don’t know.”
zh: 「我不知道，我不知道。」

en: Hans leans down and checks for a pulse.
zh: 漢斯俯下身去，檢查她的脈搏。

en: “She’s still alive. Help me get her up onto the deck.”
zh: 隨後他點點頭，像是鬆了一口氣：「她還活著，幫我把她扶到露台上。」

en: They get her upright, each holding one of her arms over their shoulders as they lift her onto the deck.
zh: 他們把她扶起來，把她的手臂分別搭在他們的肩膀上，把她抬到露台上。

en: The sun loungers there haven’t been cleaned after the winter, they’re covered in dead leaves and cobwebs and bird crap, but between them they get her laid down on one.
zh: 冬天過後，太陽椅還沒有清洗，上面滿是枯葉、蛛網和鳥屎，他們把她扶到一張椅子上，讓她躺下。

en: “We can’t just leave her like this,” Jerry says. “It’s too cold.”
zh: 「讓她這樣可不行，」傑瑞說，「太冷了。」

en: “Why did you come here?”
zh: 「你為什麼到這裏來了？」

en: Hans asks. “You’ve remembered where the journal is?”
zh: 漢斯問，「你能記得日記在哪裡嗎？」

en: “I don’t even know why I came here.”
zh: 傑瑞說，「我甚至不知道我為什麼會來這裏。」

en: “Do you know where it is?”
zh: 「你知道在哪裡嗎？」

en: Jerry nods. “The guy in there has it. The new owner of the house. Gary Somebody.
zh: 傑瑞點點頭：「在住在這裏的人手裡，房子的新主人，名叫加里。

en: It’s in there somewhere.
zh: 它就在房子里的某處。

en: That must be why I came back.”
zh: 這就是為什麼我回來了。」

en: “Then we need to go in and get it,” Hans says.
zh: 「那我們需要進去，找到它。」漢斯說。

en: “She called the police,” Jerry says, looking down at Mrs. Smith.
zh: 「她叫了警察。」傑瑞說，低頭看看史密斯太太。

en: “She said that?”
zh: 「她說的？」

en: “Yeah.”
zh: 「是啊。」

en: “Okay, then we don’t need to worry about her getting cold because they’ll be on their way.”
zh: 「好吧，那麼我們不必擔心她會挨凍了，因為他們正在來的路上。」

en: He pulls Jerry back in the direction of the street. “If we have to, we can come back later.”
zh: 他把傑瑞推回街上，「有必要的話，我們可以以後再回來。」

en: They reach the car. It’s not the same car Hans was driving earlier.
zh: 他們走到汽車旁，這不是漢斯之前開的那輛車。

en: It isn’t until Jerry is sitting down and putting on his seat belt that he realizes they’re not alone.
zh: 傑瑞坐進去，系好安全帶，這才意識到車上不止他們兩人。

en: Eric the orderly is slumped across the backseat, eyes closed and softly snoring.
zh: 那個護理員艾瑞克靠在後座上，閉著眼睛，輕輕打著鼾。
